featured.text: Newspapers, radio and TV stations, and websites have participated in the April 1 tradition of making 20 reports in order to fool their audiences.
Beginning around 1910, audiences developed a taste for serial action movies, which 26 the use of dedicated stunt people to perform in dangerous scenes.
The average age of the audience was between fifty and sixty.
He was worried that the audience would fall asleep since most of the 75-minute performance was a cappella, that is, singing without instrumental sound.

other.text: The ballet dancers’ __________ movements delighted all the audience.
This talk show, ________, is quite popular with the audience.
The audience could not visualize the theme sung by the school children.
At the closing ceremony of the Olympic Games, all the athletes ________ good-bye to the audience.
On his first trip to Europe, why did Camake think the audience might fall asleep? (A)
In 2011, they were voted as one of the world’s top five performance groups by audiences of Japan Broadcasting Corporation’s Amazing Voice program.
Dr. Chu’s speech on the new energy source attracted great _____ from the audience at the conference.
Surprisingly, the audience listened with full focus and high spirits.
enviously 7. _______ to what you think, our TV program has been enjoyed by a large audience.

The speaker, carefully programmed, arrived on the stage under its own power and proceeded to tell the audience of 658 graduates, their families, and friends that they would have to learn to work with robots and technology to solve society’s problems.

definition.en_def: A group of people who come together to watch or listen to a performance, speech, or presentation.
definition.example: The audience applauded after the performance.
